comments.body: Is it possible to avoid the use of the **kwargs and just add name=None instead?
It appears to be unavoidable, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20961100/passing-default-parameters-with-varargs-in-function-in-python

I would like to propose one more fix. I think this should be changed from:

```
shapes = [[dim if dim else -1
           for dim in tensor.get_shape().as_list()]
           for tensor in inputs]
```

to:

```
shapes = [[dim if dim is not None else -1
           for dim in array_ops.unpack(array_ops.shape(tensor))]
           for tensor in inputs]
```

in order to allow for dynamic tensor shapes. I run into an issue while using `tf.einsum` and this change fixed it for me.
Did anyone notice this comment before merging?

I did not. I agree with you though. Is this the only place that would need changing?

Do you want to send a PR with this change (and test coverage for it)?

Sounds good! I made PR #5174 but without any test coverage. I have a paper deadline approaching and I'm not sure about your test conventions, so I thought I'd leave it there for now. This change alone seems to be working fine for me, although I haven't tried using it with any edge cases.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +184,188 @@  reduction_idx = []
  shapes = [[dim if dim else -1
             for dim in tensor.get_shape().as_list()]
            for tensor in inputs]
